intro: Dolicholus simplicifolius, commonly known as the simple-leaf dolicholus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
